column5:
Vets can be quite expensive and it can be hard to find one that takes small rodents. I recently had to take one of my boys in for a check up which was $60, and then the medicine was $12. I called 5 vets and only found one that takes rats. I‚Äôm not sharing this to say what you should or shouldn‚Äôt do, but to just provide more information.

A good place to start would be to look into what your situation would be. Maybe call some vets and see if they take rats, and what a check up would cost, etc.
Thanks for the info!
What does this mean?
You‚Äôre very welcome. I‚Äôm so new to this but I‚Äôm glad my insights could be of some use!

Honestly maybe therapy can help! I don‚Äôt think you‚Äôd need therapy long term or anything, but having that unbiased party with expertise and with whom you can share the little things you may not want to share with others goes a long way. You can just see it as having a coach.

Not to mention they can help find the triggers, underlying causes, patterns, habits, etc. it‚Äôs helped me a ton.
This is so encouraging thanks for sharing!

Hey there! I‚Äôm super new to this, so take what I say with that perspective.

It would be useful to meditate for a few minutes everyday and visualize your face looking perfect and how you want it, and how that would feel. Don‚Äôt focus on the absence of scar specifically, but just the overall loveliness of that perfect face. Enjoy it, feel it as if it is now, etc. Then if after one of these meditation sessions you feel inspired to take an action, take it! And if not, just enjoy the peace of your manifestation coming to you. If you sense you are trying to force it into existence take a step back.

Another thing that could be useful is every time you see the scar in the mirror, rather than focusing on how you want it gone or how much you dislike the look of it, focus on how much you love your face. ‚ÄúLove what you have now and you create more of it‚Äù kind of thing. 

But also don‚Äôt just bulldoze your natural emotional response. In my experience that just makes negative feelings/thoughts louder in the long run. I.e. if you feel a negative emotion about yourself as a result of seeing the scar, it could be useful to spend some time evaluating that feeling and listening to it so you can repair that part of yourself. Build the sense of self love in that respect, because lacking that is a big block. It‚Äôs as if a neglected part of you is crying out for help, if that makes sense. If a part of you is hurt you can‚Äôt just pat it in the head and tell it it‚Äôs not hurt and expect things to get better.

I ended up saying a whole lot more than I meant too! You ended up with more of a psychology lecture than an answer to your question, but hopefully there was something useful for you in there.

I‚Äôd love to hear updates about your journey if you feel like sharing!

One thing that helps me is manifesting that my positive thoughts and feelings will be very strong, and my negative thoughts and feelings will be very weak. It‚Äôs from the book ‚Äúthe secret‚Äù. It‚Äôs very nice later when I worry I‚Äôm self sabotaging because then all it takes it for me to remind myself something like ‚Äúthis is okay, because this process is so incredible and powerful that I can still have everything good even if I‚Äôm feeling negativity‚Äù if that makes sense.

Also emotional care in general is just very important. So I think it would be a mistake to not take the time you need to mourn what is an actual loss!

I‚Äôm still learning. And I‚Äôve only successfully manifested a few small things so far that I could excuse away as coincidence if I was being skeptical. BUT I have drastically changed my life for better via manifesting good in general, and not being so specific just yet. So what I‚Äôm saying is, I focus on saying to myself, reminding myself, and believing that ‚Äúgood things happen to me ALL the time‚Äù. It‚Äôs easier for me to feel and hold on to. That way whatever it is I‚Äôm doing or pursuing I‚Äôm manifesting general positivity with it. And it makes me feel more confident going in, and less like I have to force a specific outcome by being ‚Äúproperly spiritual‚Äù. And honestly? Good things do happen to me all the time. Like multiple times a day.

Good luck!

Good luck! If you can‚Äôt find the fb group let me know. I‚Äôm not in it, fortunately I haven‚Äôt had to use it. I can ask my friend who told me about it though.

Do you have a relationship with your vet? If so you could try calling and seeing if they think it‚Äôs worth coming in.

I know there are also groups on Facebook where you can get feedback from vets and see what they recommend.

I‚Äôm so so sorry. I am crying for you right now. I don‚Äôt know if it helps at all to know that but I have so much compassion for you. I just want to validate you that you have and are experiencing something extremely traumatic. You‚Äôve taken such a huge important step in reaching out here. You need professional help ASAP. Do you need help? Can I call and set up an appointment for you? I can‚Äôt imagine what you are going through. Thank you for your bravery in saving her, in facing the trauma since then, and sharing here.
I‚Äôm so sorry the extra sleep isn‚Äôt enough to keep you going! I hope you get advice that will help you deal with it, I can‚Äôt even imagine

I up my sleep at night by like2 hours. It‚Äôs super inconvenient but it helps me not nap during the day (she said, having just woke up from a 3 hour nap because she didn‚Äôt get extra sleep last night üôÑ)
I‚Äôve never used SWS so excuse me if this is totally idiotic: but could you make your own?

It‚Äôs been over two years. After my baby died I realized how much shit I was putting up with in my life and decided to stop putting up with it. Specifically I realized I was in a cult, and left soon thereafter. It was all so terrible, but leaving was basically the only good thing that came of her death. I like to think if she had lived it would have shocked me out of the cult as well, but who knows. Certainly glad not to be raising a child in that setting either way.

I‚Äôm back in a slump now. It‚Äôs almost the anniversary of her due date. And I‚Äôm putting up with shit because I‚Äôm too unmotivated to change my life right now. It ebbs and flows. Some days I feel like I‚Äôve been stuck in time since she died, and other days I‚Äôm in awe of how much healing I have done.
No problem. And it‚Äôs therapeutic for me to share, makes me feel less alone
Very well said. I second all of this.

2ish weeks for me (I‚Äôm so sorry you are dealing with 75% of your month this way. I thought I had it bad!

Emotional/mental:

Either terrible emotions or none at all. Like just nothing. Total pointlessness to the whole of my existence. Zero motivation or my whole world is falling apart and I can‚Äôt see any part of my life as not being a disaster. And when I‚Äôm not in hell week it‚Äôs hard to understand how I felt so awful about my awesome life.

Brain fog. Poor attention to detail. Inability to focus. Out of touch with my surroundings. Very accident prone.

My thoughts race. It‚Äôs basically like extreme rumination that I can‚Äôt stop. Very cyclical. Very negative. Often times this includes very intense suicidal tendencies. It‚Äôs like my mind is being pulled into a whirlpool at the bottom of a pit. Dramatic, I know.

Very sensitive. Resting state is angry and defensive.

Physical: 

Poor sleep. Exhaustion. Body aches. Fatigue.

Extreme appetite or no appetite. Swelling, bloating. I have mild allergies/intolerances to some foods that just flare right up. IBS (although not as bad as it used to be since I‚Äôve identified my trigger foods and drink more water)

Acneeeeeee üò¢ deep, painful, hormonal acne



That‚Äôs the bulk of it. The racing thoughts are really what get me. Still haven‚Äôt found a good way to cope when it happens.

Hope this helped and that you can find solutions for your own life üòä

Unfortunately I don‚Äôt know enough to tell you for every supplement. As a general rule, if it has a really high potency (like the percent of daily value) it usually means it‚Äôs less bio available. Supplements aren‚Äôt well regulated so it‚Äôs hard to always tell if you don‚Äôt research about each supplement and what to look out for. It‚Äôs a big stress ball honestly. 

The only supplement I‚Äôm taking right now is Magnesium. The most bioavailable form of it is Magnesium Citrate, but my first time getting it I just picked up ‚Äúmagnesium‚Äù at the grocery store. It turned out to be another form that was basically indigestible. 

Good luck. Wish I was more helpful but I hope this at least saves you a little time!
My heart. Those little hand twitches.
It‚Äôs all part of the struggle! Hahahahaha *weeps soflty*

Have you tried multiple kinds? Just curious because I‚Äôm still figuring things out. I have heard/read that some people are sensitive to different hormones. So one birth control can make it worse, whereas another could potentially fix it.
Others have commented better info than I would have said! But I just wanted to stress the importance of making sure your supplements are good quality and bioavailable.

This! Oh my gosh this! I recently posted about what has been making my PMDD go away (like I still have issues but I think I wouldn‚Äôt have gotten diagnosed with my current symptoms) and EMDR has made a HUGE difference, and it‚Äôs a therapy that helps you work through trauma. I have felt physical changes.
I‚Äôm so sorry for your loss.
Outstanding!
Good luck!

It‚Äôs a type of therapy. It stands for eye movement desensitization and reprocessing. The way my therapist explains it is that this therapy method taps into a similar process as what your brain uses while you‚Äôre sleeping. So just as a dream may feel like hours but really be 10 minutes or even 10 seconds, through emdr you can deal with trauma in a safe space and an accelerated rate. The therapist uses eye movement (similar to how your eyes move during the REM cycle of sleep) to engage this process in the brain.

For me I not only visualize things in a dream like way as I process it, but it also elicited a strong response from my body. I just felt things shift inside. It‚Äôs hard to explain, but it is very impactful. But I‚Äôve always stored stress or negativity in my body (I.e. neck tension, IBS, migraines, tmj, etc.) so it makes sense that I would react that way. And for me personally I‚Äôm not surprised that‚Äôs it‚Äôs tied to my PMDD.

2 weeks is a really short time frame to already be seeing results, especially if your hair is badly damaged like it sounds like it is. 

I‚Äôm not an expert by any means (definitely worth getting more view points) but I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs worth giving it more time. Just keep your hair in loose poney tails, braids, buns etc while it‚Äôs transitioning.

I am very sorry for your loss as well. Words can‚Äôt describe. And I agree completely about this being the worst club, but at the very least it is helpful that we can reach out and relate to each other. Feel free to reach out at any time if you need/want to talk.

My baby had a cyst develop on the umbilical chord. They did a test and it appeared there was enough flow that it wouldn‚Äôt be a problem. Later she developed hydrops, which she eventually died from. We still don‚Äôt know if they were connected. 

First and only baby so far, so can‚Äôt give anecdote of whether we‚Äôve run into the issue again, but I have heard its super rare as well.
I love it!

Oh okay great idea, I will do that.
When you say in your robe do you mean in a pocket or something? And they stay there? Do they seem scared or content?

So how do I make my hands seem like toys? Do you have some examples? 

And they actually let me pet them the other day. They didn‚Äôt seem to enjoy it but it also didn‚Äôt seem totally traumatizing. I pet their cheeks and their backs. It helped that they were looking for treats, at least they‚Äôve started to associate me with food! Haha

I will start petting them more and hopefully they will start enjoying it soon!

I rarely pick them up because they immediately start pooping, their hearts start racing, and they start doing everything they can to get back in their cage. I would love it if I could figure out how to have them just hang out like that. I‚Äôd love to hear more about the details of what you do.

For my trust training the first few days was just offering treats to them until finally they took them from me. Then getting them used to walking into my hand for the treat, and now they actually will go all the way to my shoulder for something they really like. As of today they have actually started staying put on my arm sometimes while they eat so they can get a second treat, which is hugely morale boosting for me!

Perhaps I should pick them up more. Do you think that would be effective? Like if it became a routine and they started to realize they didn‚Äôt die from it?
I am very sorry for your loss as well. Hopefully it helps at least a little.
Oh my gosh!! I just got rats and I am so doing this!

I was tortured by nightmares of the delivery room after I lost my baby. 

What finally resolved it was writing down the memories. 

It will be a very emotional experience. In writing, I walked through every poignant and painful detail of the delivery. Every regret, every hurt, every bit of guilt or shame, every bit of anger no matter how ‚Äúirrational‚Äù, every conflicting thought, etc.

I took am about a week to do it, because sometimes I‚Äôd write a single sentence and feel like my world was crashing down. I bawled and bawled.

But when I was done, the dreams stopped.

Hopefully you can find something that works for you too. So much love.
Oh darn, no where near. It was worth a shot though
Are you adopting these babies out when they are older? Just wondering because we are looking to adopt two males in the next month or two

I can‚Äôt go through with it because I don‚Äôt have a method picked that I feel confident would be completely effective. I only want to try if I know I‚Äôll be effective. Something I can start and won‚Äôt be able to reverse when I panic. I also don‚Äôt want the result to be gory, because I am married and most likely my spouse will find it. The idea of passing on my pain and scars to another living soul stops me, too. Like, somehow I can just go on suffering because it means someone else isn‚Äôt. I‚Äôll take this burden to spare my spouse. Once I‚Äôm dead I won‚Äôt care but me right now cares a little still.
I feel this so much. To not exist. To never have existed.
